Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that former Rep. Trey Gowdy did not write the viral post.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or proof to support the conspiracy theory.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption that the COVID-19 pandemic was planned to help Democrats in the 2020 election without any evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the COVID-19 pandemic and assumes a specific motive without any basis.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the significance of the COVID-19 outbreak in relation to the impeachment of President Trump and the upcoming election.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by falsely attributing the viral post to former Rep. Trey Gowdy when he has denied writing it.
